sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The whatcolor function is used to determine the current (foreground) color, ie., the color used for characters that are output using put. The alternate spelling is whatcolour.
sections.text_content: The whatcolor function is used to determine the current (foreground) color, ie., the color used for characters that are output using put. The alternate spelling is whatcolour.
sections.mdown_content: The **whatcolor** function is used to determine the current (foreground) color, ie., the color used for characters that are output using **put**. The alternate spelling is **whatcolour**.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        Â…
        put "This writing is in color number ", whatcolor
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the currently-active color number. The message is also given in the currently-active color.
sections.text_content: This program outputs the currently-active color number. The  message is also given in the currently-active color.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the currently-active color number. The  message is also given in the currently-active color.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. See setscreen for details.
sections.text_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. See setscreen for details.
sections.mdown_content: The screen should be in a "*screen*"* *or "*graphics*" mode. See **setscreen** for details.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the color procedure, which is used to set the color. See also colorback and whatcolorback.

See also predefined unit Text.
sections.text_content:
the color procedure, which is used to set the color. See also colorback and whatcolorback.
